translated: The Chapter of Threes

analyzed: subhā jīva kamba vanikā therī gāthā
translated: The Elder Nun Subhā, the Daughter of Jīvaka the Doctor
The delightful Jīvaka’s Wood,🔽Subhā, the nun, was going there;
Dhuttaka stopped her,
and Subhā said to him:
“What have I done to offend you,

original: Yaṁ maṁ ovariyāna tiṭṭhasi;🔽Na hi pabbajitāya āvuso,
analyzed: yam mama ovariyāna tiṭṭhasi  na hi pabbajitāya āvuso
translated: that you stand in front of me?🔽For a man is not allowed to touch

analyzed: purisaḥ samphusanāya kappati  garuke mama satthu sāsane
translated: a nun who has gone forth, my friend.🔽The training taught by the Buddha
is weighty in my Teacher’s Dispensation.
The path is pure and stainless,
why do you stand in front of me?
With a defiled mind, you stand in front of me,
one who is stainless, without defilement,
with a mind liberated in every way.
Why do you stand in front of me?”

analyzed: daharā ca a pāpikā ca si
translated: “You are young and innocent,
what will going forth do for you?
Throw away your ochre robe,
come, let’s enjoy ourselves in the flowering wood.
The whole wood is fragrant with honey,
the trees are covered with pollen;
the first spring month is a pleasant season,
come, let’s enjoy ourselves in the flowering wood.
And the trees with their crests of flowers,
As if they were crying out at the sound of the wind;
What pleasure will you have,
If you go alone to the forest?

analyzed: vāḷa miga saṅgha sevita  kuñjara matta kareṇu loḷita
translated: Haunted by herds of wild beasts,🔽Stirred up by the trunks and ears of elephants in rut;
You wish to go without a companion,
To the great forest, which is frightening and devoid of people.

analyzed: dhītikā  vicarasi cittalatā iva accharā  kāsika su khumehi vaggubhi
translated: You are like a lightning flash,🔽You move like a fairy on a painted canvas;🔽You are beautiful with your fine garments of Kāsi silk,
With your incomparable well-made clothes.
I could be your slave,
If we were to live in the forest;
For there is no living being dearer to me than you,
O Kinnara with eyes like lotus petals.
If you will do what I say,
Come and live in the house happily;
You will live in a well-ventilated mansion,
And women will do your work for you.
Wear fine garments of Kāsi silk,

analyzed: abhiropehi ca mālavaṇṇaka  kañcana maṇi muttakam bahu
translated: And apply Mālava dye;🔽I will make for you much gold, jewels and pearls,
And various ornaments.🔽A beautiful new bed, well-spread with a white coverlet,
With a pillow of cotton wool,

analyzed: abhiruha sayanam mahāraha             uppalam ca udakā
translated: You climb up to your expensive bed,🔽Anointed with sandalwood and fragrant.
Like a lotus that has come up from the water,🔽As if it were frequented by non-humans;
So, you who are celibate,
You will come to old age in your own body.”
“What is considered the essence here,
In this body that is filled with filth and increases in the charnel ground;
In this body that is subject to breaking up,
Seeing which you are displeased?”
“Your eyes are like those of a deer,
Like a kinnara woman in the mountains;
Seeing your eyes,

analyzed: bhiyyas kāma ratī pavaḍḍhati  uppala sikhara upamāni te
translated: My passion for love increases more and more.🔽Your eyes are like the peak of a lotus,
In your face that is spotless and like gold;
Seeing your eyes,
My passion for love increases more and more.
Even from afar, I long for you,
With your long eyelashes and pure vision;
There is no one dearer to me than you,
O you with eyes like a kinnara’s moon.”
“You wish to go by an impassable path,
You seek the moon as a plaything;
You wish to scale Mount Meru,
You who seek out the Buddha’s disciple.

analyzed: na atthi hi loke sa devake
translated: For there is no passion in the world,
where it might be for me now.
I don’t even know where it is,
so it’s been destroyed by the path, root and all.
Like a seed cast on a plowed field,

original: Visapattoriva aggito kato;🔽Napi naṁ passāmi kīriso,
analyzed: visapattoḥ iva kataḥ  na pi nam passāmi kīriso
translated: made poisonous by fire,
I don’t even see it, so it’s been destroyed by the path, root and all.
For one who has not reflected,

original: Satthā vā anupāsito siyā;🔽Tvaṁ tādisikaṁ palobhaya,
analyzed: satthā vā an upāsito siyā  tvam tādisikam palobhaya
translated: or who has not attended on the Teacher,🔽you can seduce such a one.
But you’re harassing one who knows.
For I’m not agitated or excited,
and mindfulness is established regarding pleasure and pain.
Knowing that conditioned things are inconstant,
my mind doesn’t cling to anything at all.
I’m a disciple of the One Well-Gone,

analyzed: magga ṭṭhaṅgika yāna yāyinī  uddhaṭa sallā anāsavā
translated: who goes by the path with eight factors.🔽My dart has been pulled out, I’m free of defilements.
I delight in the empty house.

original: Diṭṭhā hi mayā sucittitā,🔽Sombhā dārukapillakāni vā;
analyzed: diṭṭhā hi mayā su citti tā  sombhā dāru kapillakāni vā
translated: I’ve seen the well-constructed things,🔽the bamboo and wooden parts,
bound together with strings and nails,
the various kinds of musical instruments.
When the strings and nails are pulled out,
When it is cut up, divided, and separated,
It would not be found in any of its parts,
So where would you place your mind?

original: Tathūpamā dehakāni maṁ,🔽Tehi dhammehi vinā na vattanti;
analyzed: tathā upamā dehakāni  tehi dhammehi vinā na vattanti
translated: So too, these bodily parts are like that,🔽Without those things they do not function.
Without those things it does not function,
So where would you place your mind?

original: Yathā haritālena makkhitaṁ,🔽Addasa cittikaṁ bhittiyā kataṁ;
analyzed: yathā haritālena makkhita  addasa cittikam bhittiyā kata
translated: Just as on a wall that’s been plastered with green clay🔽You’d see a picture that’s been drawn,
In that you have a distorted view,

original: Saññā mānusikā niratthikā.🔽Māyaṁ viya aggato kataṁ,
analyzed: saññā mānusikā niratthikā  mā ayam viya aggataḥ kata
translated: Human perception is pointless.🔽Like a trick, it’s been made to look good,
Like a golden tree in a dream;
You approach it blind and empty-handed,

analyzed: jana majjheḥ iva ruppa rūpaka  vaṭṭaniḥ iva koṭa rohitā
translated: Like a mannequin in the middle of people.🔽Like a hollow bamboo,
With a bubble in the middle, full of water,
A boil is born right there,
With various eye-diseases collected together”.
Having laughed, the one with beautiful eyes
Did not shine, her mind unattached.

original: “Handa te cakkhuṁ harassu taṁ”,🔽Tassa narassa adāsi tāvade.🔽Tassa ca viramāsi tāvade,
analyzed: handa te cakkhum harassu ta  tassa narassa adāsi tāvade  tassa ca viramāsi tāvade
translated: “Come, let’s destroy your eye,”🔽She immediately gave it to that man.🔽And right there her passion ceased,
She forgave him right there.
“Safe may be a celibate,
But never again will there be one like this.”

analyzed: āsādiya edisam jana  aggim pajjalitava liṅgiya
translated: “Having approached such a person,🔽Like kindling a blazing fire,
And grasping it like a poisonous snake,

original: Api nu sotthi siyā khamehi no”.
analyzed: api nu sā utthi siyā khamehi naḥ
translated: Can there be safety? Forgive us.”
And then that nun was released,
And went to the presence of the Excellent Buddha;
Seeing the one with excellent merit and good characteristics,
Her eyes were as if they were as they were before.
… the Elder Nun Subhā, the daughter of Jīvaka Ambavana …
The Thirty-Third Chapter is finished.
